summary: The Cisco Certified Network Associate (CCNA) course covers a wide range of networking topics. Participants will learn about the role and function of network components, network topology architectures, and physical interface and cabling types. The course includes configuring and verifying IPv4 and IPv6 addressing, VLANs, interswitch connectivity, Layer 2 discovery protocols, and EtherChannel. It also covers wireless principles, AP and WLC management access, routing table components, static routing, OSPFv2, NAT, NTP, DHCP, and remote access using SSH. Security concepts, program elements, and device access control are also discussed. The course is part of the CISCO IT Academy program at Bar-Ilan University, offered in a hybrid format with classes on campus and via Zoom.
full_text:
COURSE NAME: Cisco Certified Network Associate (CCNA)

COURSE OVERVIEW: This is the original course from CISCO, part of the CISCO IT Academy program, offered by the School of High-Tech and Cyber at Bar-Ilan University. The course aims to equip participants with the sought-after IT certification.

COURSE SCHEDULE: 
- Start Date: 03.01.2025
- Duration: 17 sessions
- Academic Hours: 85
- Schedule: Tuesdays from 17:30 to 21:30, Fridays from 09:00 to 13:00

LEARNING FORMAT: 
- The course is hybrid.
- Classes will be held on the Bar-Ilan University campus in Ramat Gan and via Zoom, according to your preference.

COURSE TOPICS: 
- Explain the role and function of network components.
- Describe characteristics of network topology architectures.
- Compare physical interface and cabling types.
- Configure and verify IPv4 addressing and subnetting.
- Configure and verify IPv6 addressing and prefix.
- Describe wireless principles.
- Configure and verify VLANs (normal range) spanning multiple switches.
- Configure and verify interswitch connectivity.
- Configure and verify Layer 2 discovery protocols.
- Configure and verify (Layer 2/Layer 3) EtherChannel (LACP).
- Describe AP and WLC management access connections.
- Interpret the components of the routing table.
- Configure and verify IPv4 and IPv6 static routing.
- Configure and verify single area OSPFv2.
- Configure and verify inside source NAT using static and pools.
- Configure and verify NTP operating in a client and server mode.
- Configure and verify DHCP client and relay.
- Configure network devices for remote access using SSH.
- Define key security concepts (threats, vulnerabilities, exploits, and mitigation techniques).
- Describe security program elements (user awareness, physical access control).
- Configure device access control using local passwords.
- Describe security password policies elements.

REGISTRATION AND CONTACT INFORMATION: 
- To schedule an admission interview and registration, contact Esther Asulin at 052-5886002 or esther.asulin@biu.ac.il.

INSTITUTIONAL INFORMATION: Bar-Ilan University invites you to acquire the sought-after IT certification as part of its School of High-Tech and Cyber program.
